sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'; import './contact.css'; import emailjs from 'emailjs-com'; import { Dialog, DialogActions, DialogContent, DialogContentText, Button, DialogTitle } from "@material-ui/core"; export default function Contact({showModal,handleClose}) { const[isEmptyEmail, setIsEmptyEmail]=React.useState('e-empty') const[isEmptyName, setIsEmptyName]=React.useState('n-empty') function sendEmail(e) { e.preventDefault(); //This is important, i'm not sure why, but the email won't send without it emailjs.sendForm(process.env.REACT_APP_SERVICE_ID, process.env.REACT_APP_TEMPLATE_ID, e.target, process.env.REACT_APP_USER_ID) .then((result) => { window.location.reload() handleClose //This is if you still want the page to reload (since e.preventDefault() cancelled that behavior) }, (error) => { }); } const isMailEmpty=(e)=>{ if(e.target.value!=='') setIsEmptyEmail('n-not-empty') else setIsEmptyEmail('n-empty') } const isNameEmpty=(e)=>{ if(e.target.value!=='') setIsEmptyName('e-not-empty') else setIsEmptyName('e-empty') } return
L e t ' s b e i n t o u c h
